repo.name: dezoomify-rs
repo.description: Zoomable image downloader for Google Arts & Culture, Zoomify, IIIF, and others

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and thorough format coverage, but lacks concrete quick-start examples and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No concrete quick-start example showing actual command execution from start to finish for a common use case

injection_risks.description: The `clap::Parser::parse()` function is used to parse command-line arguments, which could potentially lead to injection risks if not properly sanitized. However, clap is a well-maintained library and the risk is considered low.
The `parse_header` function is used to parse HTTP headers from command-line arguments, which could potentially lead to injection risks if not properly sanitized. However, the risk is considered low.

critical_findings: No validation for URL schemes in input_uri
No validation for file paths in outfile and tile_storage_folder
security.summary: The code has some potential security issues, including lack of input validation and potentially insecure default configurations, but overall it appears to be well-maintained and secure.

common_complaints: Site-specific compatibility issues (Artstor, Tate, Guernica museum, EtoMesto)
IIIF manifest handling problems (Library of Congress bulk downloads failing)
Format and output options limitations (PNG memory constraints, forced JPEG output, no lossless tile combining)
Gigapixel image format support gaps (Hirox Europe, custom image sources)
Watermark and mosaic artifacts in processed images
praise_themes: Tool is useful and appreciated for image extraction
Solves a genuine user need for accessing high-resolution artwork
sentiment.summary: Moderately active but understaffed project with mounting site-specific compatibility issues, growing user frustration over slow responses, and increasing technical debt from unsupported image formats and services.

red_flags: Lack of patience with repeated questions
communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and technical, but could be more patient and consistent in handling issues.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from December 2024
86 open issues with no recent activity
No closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: dezoomify-rs appears to be abandoned with no maintenance activity in the past 6 months despite a recent final commit.

project_metrics.description: Zoomable image downloader for Google Arts & Culture, Zoomify, IIIF, and others

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides a good overview of the package's features, but lacks troubleshooting information.
concerns: No merged PRs in the past six months, indicating a lack of community contribution or approval.
A large number of open issues (84) suggests potential bugs or feature requests that have not been addressed.
Docs: Lack of troubleshooting section or common problems and solutions documentation
Community: Library of Congress IIIF manifests do not work with --bulk option
Communication: Lack of patience with repeated questions
Communication: Inconsistent use of issue tracking
Security: No validation for URL schemes in input_uri
Security: No validation for file paths in outfile and tile_storage_folder
High bus factor risk (98% from top contributor)
highlights: Commits were made within the last six months, showing some level of activity.
There is at least one contributor active in the past six months
